the user interface is the worst part it is massively confusing mess lots of information crammed into toosmall space and denoted by confusing and unclear icons
on top of that information is often banished to different corners of the screen never before in tw game have had to spend so much time looking around to find the most basic information
even something as fundamental as giving right click drag order to unit ie
specifying the formation you want it to take at its destination has been screwed up the clear little markers for each soldier are gone replaced with thoroughly uninformative grey box
then there is the balance which is to this day an utter mess
there is enough broken that cannot be bothered to list it all suffice to say it is the least balanced tw game there has ever been
worse than the early magic in tww1 worse than the broken cavalry in attila
like the idea of restricting units to particular general types retinue

some general types are infinitely more desirable than others because they get range of great units while others are entirely worthless because their specialised unit types bring absolutely nothing you need
example the strategist is the ranged specialist and is the only general able to recruit trebuchets or decent archerscrossbows making them basically essential to every army
on the other hand commanders specialise in melee cavalry which is utterly worthless

braindead battle ai

the campaign for this game is massive leap from the clunky mess that was thrones of britannia as it has load of new features while keeping the polished and clean style of shogun 2
the diplomacy is vastly expanded with new options such as cooperative alliances ultimatums etc
generals are no longer numbers and letters on chart they are actual people who need to be appeased

gameplaywise there is two modes romance and records
records is your classic total war mode

only notable thing in romance is that heroes or your generals are alone and do not have any bodyguards in their unit and they can initiate duel with enemy generals while the rest of the world ignores them
also for some reason ai is smarter when playing records
so it is kind of like warhammer total wars heroes except with the on mechanic
not much unit variety unfortunately just like shogun 2s but this makes it kind of balanced
diplomacy kind of works
everyone will hate you except these factions with one or two specific traits always bring two artillery with you to kill half the enemy army the army stacks are actually an improvement

each general has its own classes and can recruit specific type of unit based on their class so you do not need to worry that much about the enemy building like million war elephants or equivalent here
also they have rockpapersscissors stat for the said general classes which something like good vs infantry good vs other generals etc tldr it is good
go play it if you are into chinese history or want to play balanced total war game

the worst total war game to release in the franchise to date

have played every single total war game out there and while there are elements of this one like the balance of heroes vs units is well done diplomacytrading is stronger than in many other tw games and tactical gameplay feels very well done the strategy game is mess
am westerner with very little knowledge of asianchinese history and culture so when it comes to asian names flags etc do not really have point of reference
so when am close ally of liu shang and mortal enemy of liu zhang am already pretty lost

if you then mix in the fact that most factions flags are identical the symbol that changes is usually obscured by the faction leaders portrait right now in my game have about factions with red and white striped flags one green one purple one yellow and one black all with white stripes but they are all so darkly coloured that have to concentrate to even notice the colour difference between them
then there are the ones with triangle flags few of them do stand out there is red one han empire green one and blue one the rest are variations of brown

at glance of the strategic map world map there are units all over some of them have got to be mine but have no quick way of knowing which ones it is some of the ones with redish brown flags but far from all of them
the fastest way is to simply open the list and then choose them from there
also when unit is selected it does not become highlighted so with two units next to each other there is no easy way to know which one you have selected

when you want units to support each other in combat there is seemingly also no indicator of how close they have to be for that and the distance does seem to vary whether due to terrain or what know not  hopefully there will be mods to fix some of these issues but as it stands it is probably sadly my least favourite in the total war series

dead they only have chance of winning when packing overpowered characters

as total war fanboy want to give this thumbs up and creative assembly did so much to revolutionize the game with daring creativity that applaud
but realized when talking about the total war franchise to my coworker just cannot recommend this game
it is worth trying but it is not the cornerstone of pc gamers library like older titles were will start off with saying am bit biased with the theme
the chinese culture just is not pulling me in like rome or medieval did
it is wonderfully well done however so this is bias i’m trying to overlook while giving review but undeniably may be negatively impacting my overall fondness of the game
things liked building up provinces or “commanderies” are not as cookie cutter
you can’t choose what to build in minor settlements so you have to decide if you want to “snowball
” those benefits with what you build in the main city or “force
this gives lot of replayability but also can make the game brutal for new or returning total war players
it also blends well with the enhanced diplomacy
made too much food and not enough money
trade it for cash with someone
diplomacy is easier to jump into with much more impact than in previous games
it adds deep layer of strategy to the game
the focus on characters gives the game “crusader kings
the army retinue system units tied to characters is much more streamlined approach

units don’t “die” like they did in previous games and you don’t need to ferry units all over the map because they had to be made in particular cities also makes building construction strategy easier in that regard
it was bit of slap in the face though when learned that top end dragon units can be made under any character but midlevel units you unlock have to match the color of the character
reforms tech tree is neat how it’s purely turn based
no research bonuses
makes for consistent game and adds to replayability
you can pick either romance mode or records mode with records being more traditional to total war
was led to believe records was for the hardcore traditionalist that values tactics and troop management
a fan would argue it actually makes the battles harder
your first goal is now to manage your generals vs their generals and sort out the cannon fodder minion troops later
learned after looking up guides that most players at least veteran players of it prefer records mode and not because of the difficulty of it
so tried records much much better  characters
the character development seemed interesting especially since am huge fan of crusader kings 2
it is lack of enjoyment does not balance out the tedium of the management
manageable to prevent that sure but it is just an extra layer have to worry about now without any payoff of fun  the cartooniness of it
the fighting in battles just does not have any meat to it
it is like watching warcraft iii troops fight
troop swings at air
troop flies back in comical fashion
rome was way more satisfying for interpersonal combat
you could almost feel the brutalness of veteran experienced army
video after video tells you how powerful archers are in this game
but it is like watching laser light show with enemies falling over at random
in rome the arrows are getting buried in shields pinging the ground and having troops stumble to the ground
in truth bet the mechanics are fairly similar but maybe it is the graphics or art on top of it that make it feel less meaty
in the end it is still good enough game but would not recommend it over other titles in the series
this game is awesome graphics are awesome characters are awesome

the battles themselves are also step back from wh and the melee is not cinematic nor epic

its actually often difficult to make out which troops are yours but you would really care either way as you feel absolutely zero affiliation to them as they all look very clonelike similar to how the troops in rome ii or attila felt
actually would prefer to play either of those games over this title as both had something to endear themselves to you about

h1first impressionsh1 as long time fan of the total war series have to say this is the most polished tw game have ever played
have not noticed any bugs so far the user interface is absolutely beautiful and fits the historical setting of three kingdoms and the battles are of course great fun
the diplomacy system is massive improvement over thrones of britannia which was not exactly complete game but rest my case and the campaign map itself is very nice to look at
the graphics are sight for sore eyes not to mention the fact that ca managed to optimize the game much better than thrones of britannia so it actually runs well
am really enjoying the romance mode which essentially turns generals on both sides of the battlefield into overpowered killing machines
would definitely recommend it to fans of the total war series and generally to anyone who enjoys rts and turnbased strategy games

first impressions review am new to the total war series but always loved political strategic realtime battle games like age of empires but this works with turn by turn system which gives you the freedom to take your time when its you
unlike age of empires where it is race for feudal age and kill the enemy
in this game you choose faction leader to lead your people and start your empire from there
the tutorial for beginners is extremely helpful and made the learning curve interesting and easy to grasp all the different options and mechanics
negotiate with your friends to form nonaggression agreements or peace treaties
persuade your allies to go to war with your enemies
have children arrange marriage at 18 make him become prince one day
micromanagement but turn by turn system lets you figure it out at your own pace
the music and sound is great
graphics are par but blame my pc specs
battles will have you sit on the edge of your seat very fun to control and watch
every decision you make can impact your relationships within your empire and other factions around you
family corruption family jealousy there is lot here and am only hours in at this point of the review

actually do not bother rating games but this total war is something cannot be ignored epic duels satisfying music court and governing system diplomacy system works more positive than the ex total war series equip your generals with looted gearsweaponsdecorationfollowers campaign ai is much smarter and cunning in both diplomacy and in war also looks way out when in tight situations by making alliance or vassalage to other strong factions to overcome your power or offering vassalage to you actually if stay and tell all the wonderful features then will need huge page to fill in hahaha 100 perfect on all aspects
campaign is very fun

11 year veteran of the series here and cannot believe am saying this but this is the best total war game yet
they have fixed like 90 of the problems have ever had with the series

the characters are engaging the sieges feel like actual freakin sieges everything is gorgeous and fluid and easy to understand and after all these years they have finally found way to make the end game fun have completed campaigns and have not found faction that did not have fun with

to give you an idea of how dynamic and awesome this game can be my favorite moment in total war game ever happened while playing as zheng jiang when managed to strike an incredible deal to marry my faction leader to lu bu the best general in the game but the jerk divorced me and left my faction the next turn

not one to let man get away rehired his ass and straight up adopted him giving him the rank of faction heir so he would not leave providing me with my new favorite quote and everyday mantra if he will not be your honey make him your sonny
am not history buff and know even less about chinese history but have found the history peppered throughout this game to be particularly fascinating
it is even encouraged me to go and read further details about the period of history it covers
in terms of gameplay this feels like game that can happily sit alongside my love for the warhammer tw games
it is less asynchronous than warhammer was which can be good or bad depending on your flavour but it absolutely bolsters the diplomacy mechanics and characters dynamics throughout

have tried and failed thousand times to play paradox games even though love reading stories about them this feels like the first of those games that have been able to actually dig into and enjoy with stories unfolding constantly
there are plenty of additional little helping hands for noobs like me too such as icons depicting if band of units is weak against another and everything is eased in very gently as you play
